steps.title: Draw two curved lines.
steps.content: Draw two curved lines. The top line should curve down, while the bottom line should curve up. Make sure that one of lines is longer than the other at the front of the eye.

steps.title: Draw an oval inside of the lines.
steps.content: Draw an oval inside of the lines. Erase the ones going out of the eye after. Cats' eyes can become narrow or wide depending on their emotions or environmental lighting. However, their pupils are always vertical slits when narrowed.

steps.title: Add a triangular part, then color it black.
steps.content: Add a triangular part, then color it black.

steps.title: Thicken the lines a bit.
steps.content: Thicken the lines a bit. Thicken the two ends, as well as the top and bottom. Don't over-do it or it will look weird.

steps.title: Color the eye with flat colors.
steps.content: Color the eye with flat colors. You can finish here if you only want to create a line drawing.

steps.title: Color it with more shading of the color.
steps.content: Color it with more shading of the color.

steps.title: Blend the colors a bit.
steps.content: Blend the colors a bit. If you are using a digital program, you can use the blur tool, airbrush tool or finger tool.

steps.title: Add some shading and lighting and you're done!
steps.content: Add some shading and lighting and you're done!

steps.title: You can add a single white dot for a strong highlight, or gently erase part of the pupil to show the reflection of light.
steps.content: You can add a single white dot for a strong highlight, or gently erase part of the pupil to show the reflection of light.
